description.en: The course covers the following topics: fundamentals of investing, return and risk, analysis of bonds and stocks, investment strategies, financial derivatives, and green (sustainable) investing. The course will consist of a series of interactive lectures that require active student participation, along with practical sessions held in a computer lab.
description.et: Kursus hõlmab järgmisi teemasid: investeerimise alused, tootlus ja risk, võlakirjade ja aktsiate analüüs, investeerimisstrateegiad, finantsderivatiivid ning roheline (jätkusuutlik) investeerimine. Kursus koosneb interaktiivsete loengute sarjast, mis eeldab aktiivset osalemist, ning praktilistest sessioonidest arvutiklassis.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to provide an in-depth overview of the concepts, principles, and tools of investment analysis that are widely applied in practice.
objectives.et: Ainekursuse eesmärgiks on anda süvendatud ülevaade praktikas laialdaselt kasutatavate ettevõtte rahanduse ning investeeringute analüüsi ja juhtimise kontseptsioonidest ja põhimõtetest.

learning_outcomes.en: The course contains several learning outcomes:

- Upon successful completion of the course, students will have gained knowledge about the return and risk characteristics of major asset classes (such as stocks, bonds, alternative investments, and financial derivatives). - Course participants will also understand key investment concepts, as well as the tools and models used in investment analysis. 
- Students will become more familiar with relevant financial terminology. 
- Participants will develop proficiency in applying financial theories and methods in practice, such as analyzing stocks and bonds and evaluating the return and risk of securities. 
- Participants will gain practical investing experience in a virtual environment.
- Students will also advance their skills in spreadsheet-based financial modeling using MS Excel 
- By the end of the course, participants will have developed teamwork and organizational skills as well.
learning_outcomes.et:
- Kursuse edukal läbimisel omandavad üliõpilased teadmisi peamiste varaklasside (nagu aktsiad, võlakirjad, alternatiivsed investeeringud ja finantsderivatiivid) tootluse ja riski omadustest. 
- Tudengid mõistavad ka peamisi investeerimiskontseptsioone ning investeerimisanalüüsis kasutatavaid tööriistu ja mudeleid. 
- Tudengid saavad ülevaate asjakohasest finantsterminoloogiast. 
- Osalejad arendavad oskusi finantsteooriate ja -meetodite rakendamiseks praktikas, näiteks aktsiate ja võlakirjade analüüsimisel ning väärtpaberite tootluse ja riski hindamisel. 
- Kursusel osalejad omandavad praktilisi investeerimiskogemusi virtuaalses keskkonnas.
- Üliõpilased on arendanud tabelarvutusprogrammi põhise finantsmodelleerimise oskust (MS Excel keskkonnas)
- Kursuse lõpuks peaksid olema edasi arendatud ka meeskonnatöö ja organisatsioonilised oskused.

notes.en: Classroom sessions will be recorded, and the recordings will be available on Moodle until the end of the course. However, please note that the quality of the recordings cannot be guaranteed, and some content may be missed. Therefore, it is strongly recommended to attend the classroom sessions whenever possible.
notes.et: Auditoorsed sessioonid salvestatakse ning salvestused on saadaval Moodle'is kuni kursuse lõpuni. Siiski õppejõud ei saa tagada salvestuste kvaliteeti ning osa materjalist võib osutuda puudulikuks. Seetõttu on üldine soovitus võimalusel sessioonides kohapeal osaleda.

independent_work.et:
Computational assignments are to be completed independently; cooperation between students is now allowed. Instructions and feedback will be shared and discussed on current basis.

Personal feedback will be provided on request before/after classes or during a personal appointment with the instructor.

description.et: Computational assignments for midterm and final exam preparation (20% of the final grade)
An individual test in the form of multiple-choice test (15% of final grade)
Participation in the stock market game Stock Shark - the task has to be completed  in groups of 5 people (15% of final grade)
Written final exam in the form of multiple-choice test (50% of total grade)

grade_evaluation.et: It is necessary to collect at least 51% from all the evaluation activities (an individual test, home assignments, the stock market and the final exam) in total

debt_elimination.et: All the information is listed under assessment methods.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

topic.et: Introduction. Wrap up on the topics Financial Management (2 h)

Financial instruments. Fundamentals of investing (cont.) (2 h)

Discussion of the stock market game results (4 h, in Moodle)
